intro: Elaphoglossum amorimii, commonly known as the Amorim's holly fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to the cloud forests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, leathery fronds that are typically dark green in color. The plant exhibits a unique growth habit, with its rhizomes creeping along the forest floor and producing upright, spore-bearing fiddleheads. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires high levels of atmospheric moisture to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Elaphoglossum amorimii is considered a species of conservation concern.
